sentences.en: ‘And I think you’ve got to have an awful lot of talent to then go and do what the Beatles did – he says modestly.
sentences.cn: 我想你一定得有相当出众的才华才能达到甲壳虫所达到的高度——他（书作者）说的很谨慎。

sentences.en: "You really must be very good at what you do." — "I suppose I am," Kate said modestly.
sentences.cn: “你的工作一定非常出色。”——“也许是吧，”凯特谦虚地说。

sentences.en: Britain's balance of payments improved modestly last month.
sentences.cn: 上个月英国的国际收支差额稍有改善。

sentences.en: He had been, he said modestly, swimming champ at high school.
sentences.cn: 他谦逊地说，念中学时他曾经是游泳冠军。

sentences.en: He walked very modestly behind them . He was not willing to spoil sport.
sentences.cn: 他很虚心的跟在后头, 不愿意煞风景.

sentences.en: Nevertheless, Irish house prices are now falling, if modestly.
sentences.cn: 然而, 尽管幅度很小, 爱尔兰的房价正在下降.

sentences.en: On the whole she had lived modestly, with a notable lack of ostentation.
sentences.cn: 大体上说，她生活俭朴，不事张扬。

sentences.en: She cast her eyes down modestly while Jack was talking about her.
sentences.cn: 杰克谈及她时她稍稍垂下目光.

sentences.en: She modestly kept her from interfering in other people's affairs.
sentences.cn: 她的谦虚得体使她保有不干涉他人事务的品行.

sentences.en: She modestly suggests that "sex, or at any rate gender, may account for the difference"
sentences.cn: 她谨慎地提出“性别，至少是男女的性征，也许能解释这个差异”。

sentences.en: She sat down cautiously on the red canvas cushions, knees modestly together.
sentences.cn: 她小心翼翼地在红帆布垫上坐下，膝盖矜持地并拢着。

sentences.en: She was a small, neat woman, modestly dressed.
sentences.cn: 她是个身材矮小, 干净利落的妇女, 穿着朴素.

sentences.en: The church then peeped out modestly from a clump of trees.
sentences.cn: 接着教堂从一丛绿树中含羞似地探出头来.

sentences.en: The girl cast down her eyes modestly when she was praised.
sentences.cn: 姑娘受到表扬时,谦虚地垂下了眼睛.

sentences.en: They talked modestly of their valiant efforts to keep the tanker afloat.
sentences.cn: 他们说起自己设法使油轮漂浮的英勇之举时非常谦虚。

sentences.en: Women have to dress modestly, to avoid being harassed by the locals.
sentences.cn: 女士穿着应当庄重，以免受到当地人的骚扰。

words.tran_cn: 谦虚的，谦逊的；适度的；端庄的；羞怯的
